metadata.synopsis: You wake up and find Astarion hunching over you, fangs bared. You fight him off. Caught off guard, he's alarmed and worried that you're going to kill him. He tries to be charming, explaining that he's too weak without blood. If you push back against his excuses he gets frustrated - he tries to bargain with you. If you agree to let him bite you, he's thrilled. He feels in control again. After drinking, he feels invigorated and cocky.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. add Astarion to your party4. oe qnight NIGHT_AstarionHungerC_Bite_fe3fd3a0-70d1-4bc4-8a7f-4614f89ac23d5. go to camp and take a long rest

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *You don't sleep well, flitting between dreams and nightmares.*

145.speaker: Narrator
145.text: *Maybe you wake up because you know something is wrong. Or maybe you just get lucky.*

61.speaker: Astarion
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is hunched over your bedrool, fangs baredNodeContext: Hunched over the player's bedroll, about to bite someone, but they've just woken up and are looking up at you. More deadpan than urgent.

26.speaker: Astarion
26.text: No no - it's not what it looks like, I swear!
26.context: NodeContext: Standing up from hunched position, stepping back

130.speaker: Astarion
130.text: I wasn't going to hurt you! I just needed - well, blood.

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *There, in dim firelight, you see him for what he really is: a vampire. A slave to sanguine hunger.*

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You were strangely concerned when we met the monster hunter in the swamp.

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: It's not what you think - I'm not some monster!

49.speaker: Astarion
49.text: I feed on animals! Boars, deer, kobolds - whatever I can get.

42.speaker: Astarion
42.text: I'm just too slow right now. Too weak.

119.speaker: Astarion
119.text: If I just had a little blood, I could think clearer. Fight better. Please.

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *A strange sensation courses through you, and your companion's mind unfolds, secrets half-revealed.*

173.speaker: Astarion
173.text: At best, I was sure you'd say no. More likely, you'd ram a stake through my ribs.

116.speaker: Astarion
116.text: No, I needed you to trust me. And you can trust me.

160.speaker: Astarion
160.text: Thank you. Do you think you could trust me just a little further?
160.context: NodeContext: You know you're pushing your luck a little

38.speaker: Astarion
38.text: I only need a taste, I swear.
38.context: NodeContext: He cups your cheek in his hand

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Fine. But not a drop more than you need.

161.speaker: Astarion
161.text: Really? I - of course. Not one drop more.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: All right, but go too far and I'll drive a stake through your chest.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: Ah. Of course. I shall be gentle as a babe.
13.context: NodeContext: Nervous. They have a stake against your heart.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: Let's make ourselves comfortable, shall we?
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion gestures, inviting the player to lie down on the bedroll at his feet.NodeContext: Astarion gestures, inviting the player to lie down on the bedroll at his feet.

139.speaker: Narrator
139.text: *It's like a shard of ice into your neck - a quick, sharp pain that fades to throbbing numbness. Your breath catches, your pulse quickens.*

164.speaker: Astarion
164.context: NodeContext: While biting the player's neck - you realise they've asked you to stop. You oblige and step away

27.speaker: Astarion
27.context: NodeContext: You were biting their neck, but the player pushes you back. 'ah' = surprise at being pushed.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: My mind is finally clear. I feel strong. I feel... happy!

169.speaker: Astarion
169.text: Don't be so dramatic. This is just a little transaction between friends.

93.speaker: Narrator
93.text: *You try to push him back, but his grip just gets tighter. You can feel your blood racing, coursing through both your bodies.*

134.speaker: Astarion
134.context: NodeContext: Was biting the player's neck. You break the contact and say the line.

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: I was just swept up in the moment.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: But it worked. I feel good. Strong. Happy!

125.speaker: Astarion
125.text: But I didn't. And that's what matters.

162.speaker: Astarion
162.text: And look what you've gained. Together, we can take on the world.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I hope so. I look forward to seeing you fight.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: You need to leave my camp. Now.

144.speaker: Astarion
144.text: You'd toss me aside over this?

172.speaker: Astarion
172.text: Fine. See how far you get without me.
172.context: NodeContext: Turns and walks away in a bitter rage.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: If you ever try that again, I'll cut you in half.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: It won't happen again, you have my word.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I'm looking forward to seeing you fight.

114.speaker: Astarion
114.text: Shouldn't take long. So many people need killing.

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: Now, if you'll excuse me, you're invigorating, but I need something more filling.

146.speaker: Astarion
146.text: This is a gift, you know. I won't forget it.
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Called over his shoulder as he walks awayNodeContext: Called over his shoulder as he walks away

189.speaker: Narrator
189.text: *You watch as he stalks towards the forest. Stronger. More confident. Ready to hunt.*

180.speaker: Narrator
180.text: *You watch as he stalks off. Stronger. More confident. Ready to hunt.*

66.speaker: Player
66.text: His guard's down - grab the stake and drive it into his heart.

97.speaker: Astarion
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion staked in the heartNodeContext: The player has just lunged forward and staked you in the heart. You're going to say 'you killed me'

135.speaker: Astarion
135.context: NodeContext: Astarion had been leaning over a prone player, drinking their blood, but they just tried to stab him in the chest. He jumps back, furious.

108.speaker: Narrator
108.text: *You can hear how weak your voice is. So can he, but he doesn't care. He's long past caring.*

150.speaker: Narrator
150.text: *You feel a little cold, but that's all. There's no more pain, no more fear, no more struggle. It's all over...*

192.speaker: Player
192.text: Grab the stake and drive it into his heart.

159.speaker: Astarion
159.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion staked in the heartNodeContext: You've just been staked in the heart while biting the player. You break off the bite, look at the stake in disbelief. You're going to say 'you killed me'

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *He doesn't finish the thought. It slides away as the light fades from his eyes.*

186.speaker: Astarion
186.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player stakes Astarion in the chest, breaking off the bite
Astarion had been leaning over a prone player, drinking their blood, but they just tried to stab him in the chest. He jumps back, furious.

NodeContext: You've been stabbed, but they missed your heart, so feel free to throw in a grunt of pain

115.speaker: Narrator
115.text: *You lean into him, losing yourself. You can feel your blood racing, coursing through both your bodies. A gentle, numb feeling starts to spread.*

197.speaker: Player
197.text: Fine. But not a drop more than you need.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: All right, but go too far and I'll drive a stake through your chest.

138.speaker: Astarion
138.text: Urgh! Gods! Another drop and I would've burnt a hole from lips to navel. I thought we had that fire under control?
138.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion pulls back, reacting to the heat of Karlach's blood.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: Must be the infernal engine. Sorry, Astarion, I can't help you.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Guess my blood just isn't for drinking.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Have another taste, see what happens.

52.speaker: Astarion
52.context: NodeContext: Not actually grateful; he doesn't want to bite her again, he'd die.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I'd offer to help, Astarion, but my engine still means I'm too hot to touch.

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: Gods! I'd nearly forgotten. I'm so hungry I would've bitten into anything.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Go ahead, if you want to burn your lips off.

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: Gods! I'd forgotten about your little affliction. Hunger does cloud your senses.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Go ahead. But be warned - you might bite off more than you can drink.

133.speaker: Astarion
133.text: Really? Well, let's see, shall we?

131.speaker: Narrator
131.text: *He moves in quickly, eagerly, and his bite is like a shard of ice through your neck.*

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *But something inside you stirs, and the cold fades.*
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion realises something's wrong - the blood tastes foul, like drinking vinegar

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: Urgh! You taste like bile. What in the hells is wrong with you?
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion pulls back, spitting out bloodNodeContext: You were biting his neck, but you break contact, spitting out blood in disgust

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Think of it as a warning. I am not for eating.

200.speaker: Player
200.text: You have your secrets, I have mine.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: My body's the vessel for an orb of corrupt Netherese magic, remember? Not for the faint of heart.

53.speaker: Astarion
53.text: Safe to say this will never happen again.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: That's a long story involving the goddess of magic herself. Not one I'm inclined to tell to the man who just tried to bite me.

46.speaker: Astarion
46.text: No. No, of course, silly of me to even ask.

102.speaker: Astarion
102.text: I'll go and find something on four legs to eat, I suppose.

191.speaker: Narrator
191.text: *You watch him stalk away, slumped, sulking, and ready to kill.*

88.speaker: Player
88.text: He's too dangerous. Grab the stake and drive it into his heart.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: You tried to bite me. How can I trust you?

183.speaker: Astarion
183.text: Because we don't have a choice! Not if we're going to save ourselves from these worms.

137.speaker: Astarion
137.text: I need you alive. You need me strong.

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: Please. Only be a taste, I swear. I'll be well, you'll be fine, and everything can go back to normal.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Leave. If I ever see you again, I'll kill you.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: I don't care how much you need - you're not drinking my blood.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Push into his mind, searching for the truth.

7.speaker: Astarion
7.context: NodeContext: Calmly. Someone's searching your mind, but you feel very relaxed about it.

175.speaker: Narrator
175.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *His mind opens up, revealing cracked and quivering memories. At their heart, you see dark eyes, commanding you to feed.*

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *You open your mouth and bite down. Not into a tender neck, but into the twisting body of a rat - the only thing your master lets you eat.*

2.speaker: Player
2.text: You ate animals because you were forced to. Not because you wanted to.

196.speaker: Astarion
196.text: I - yes. Yes, I ate whatever disgusting vermin my master picked. So you can see why I'm slow to trust you.

111.speaker: Astarion
111.text: But I do trust you. And you can trust me.

198.speaker: Player
198.text: Why didn't you tell me you were a vampire?

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Grab the stake and attack, trying to drive it into his heart.

166.speaker: Narrator
166.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

182.speaker: Narrator
182.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Push into his mind, searching for the truth.

113.speaker: Narrator
113.text: *You feel yourself repulsed as the doors of his mind slam shut.*

120.speaker: Astarion
120.text: This is not the time to start invading each other's minds.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I wouldn't if you'd been honest with me. Why didn't you tell me?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: It's not the time to drink each other's blood either.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Push into his mind, searching for the truth.

176.speaker: Narrator
176.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Push into his mind, searching for the truth.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: So that's why you were so quick to kill the Gur hunter: to keep your secret.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: That hunter in the swamp was right - you're a vampire spawn.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I can't believe I didn't see it - we even found the boar you snacked on.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: How long since you killed someone? Days? Hours?

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: I've never killed anyone! Well, not for food.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player picks up a stick and snaps it in two, creating a stake to threaten Astarion with.

103.speaker: Astarion
103.text: I feed on animals. Boars, deer, kobolds - whatever I can get.

154.speaker: Astarion
154.text: But it's not enough. Not if I have to fight. I feel so weak.

190.speaker: Player
190.text: Pick up a stake and lunge at the monster.
